private_information: There are five disks labeled from smallest to largest: diskA, diskB, diskC, diskD, diskE
Allowed action: move the top disk from one peg to another
Rules: move only one disk at a time, only move a disk if it is on top of its peg, never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
disk_expert.goal: Provide a clear, unambiguous specification of objects, predicates, and action schemas plus a high-level plan sketch for the Tower of Hanoi instance with 5 disks and 3 pegs. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem files directly.

private_information: Role: detect temporal and causal inconsistencies and remove modeling shortcuts or bookkeeping tokens
Ensure invariants and causal links are explicit so a forward planner will not rely on implicit assumptions
consistency_auditor.goal: Audit the disk_expert specification for temporal and causal consistency and return corrections, required invariants, and modeling adjustments to make the instance robust for an optimal planner. Do not emit PDDL directly.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate inputs from other agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem pair ready for the FastDownwards solver. The PDDL must model three pegs (left middle right) and five disks (a b c d e) with the specified initial and goal states.

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi with three pegs: left, middle, right.
Disks from smallest to largest: diskA, diskB, diskC, diskD, diskE.
Initial state: middle peg holds from top to bottom diskA, diskB, diskC, diskD, diskE; left and right pegs are empty.
Goal state: left peg holds from top to bottom diskA, diskB, diskC, diskD, diskE; middle and right pegs are empty.
Allowed action: move the top disk from one peg to another, obeying the single-disk and size-ordering constraints.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert modeler of planning problems. Provide an explicit list of objects, predicates, action schemas with clear preconditions and effects, and a concise high-level plan sketch for the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. Use unambiguous names suitable for direct translation to PDDL. Do not output PDDL files.

audit.system_prompt: You are an expert in temporal and causal consistency for planning models. Analyze the disk_spec input and report any causal flaws, hidden bookkeeping shortcuts, or temporal assumptions. Provide concrete corrections, required invariants, and modeling recommendations so the resulting PDDL will be sound for a forward optimal planner. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. Integrate the disk_spec and consistency_report and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem pair targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct, name pegs left middle right and disks a b c d e. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL uses constructs supported by FastDownwards and is immediately usable by that solver.
